seeker_post: I feel like I’m failing at everything lately.
response_post: That must be really discouraging. You’re doing your best, and that effort still matters.
rationales: You’re doing your best, and that effort still matters.

seeker_post: I can’t stop missing someone who doesn’t care anymore.
response_post: That’s deeply painful. Missing them shows how much you cared—it’s okay to still feel that way.
rationales: Missing them shows how much you cared—it’s okay to still feel that way.

seeker_post: I feel so overwhelmed with everything happening at once.
response_post: That sounds exhausting. It’s okay to slow down and take one thing at a time.
rationales: It’s okay to slow down and take one thing at a time.

seeker_post: I’m scared I’ll never be confident again.
response_post: That’s understandable. Confidence comes back gradually when you give yourself patience and care.
rationales: Confidence comes back gradually when you give yourself patience and care.

seeker_post: I feel like I’m always being left out.
response_post: That must really hurt. Feeling excluded can make anyone question their worth, but you matter.
rationales: Feeling excluded can make anyone question their worth, but you matter.

seeker_post: I can’t find joy in anything anymore.
response_post: That sounds heavy. When joy feels lost, even small steps toward comfort can help you heal.
rationales: When joy feels lost, even small steps toward comfort can help you heal.

seeker_post: I hate how much I depend on others for validation.
response_post: That’s a tough feeling. It’s okay to crave reassurance—it shows you care about connection.
rationales: It’s okay to crave reassurance—it shows you care about connection.

seeker_post: I feel like my effort never pays off.
response_post: That must be discouraging. Sometimes results take longer, but your persistence still has value.
rationales: Sometimes results take longer, but your persistence still has value.

seeker_post: I’m scared of being alone forever.
response_post: That’s a real fear. You’re not alone in wanting connection—it often finds you when least expected.
rationales: You’re not alone in wanting connection—it often finds you when least expected.

seeker_post: I can’t stop feeling like I’m running out of time.
response_post: That’s stressful. You’re still moving forward at your own pace, and that’s enough.
rationales: You’re still moving forward at your own pace, and that’s enough.

seeker_post: I feel like I’m stuck in the same painful cycle.
response_post: That’s so hard. Recognizing the pattern is already a powerful step toward change.
rationales: Recognizing the pattern is already a powerful step toward change.

seeker_post: I can’t forgive myself for hurting someone I love.
response_post: That’s a deep pain. Forgiving yourself doesn’t excuse the past—it allows healing to begin.
rationales: Forgiving yourself doesn’t excuse the past—it allows healing to begin.

seeker_post: I feel like no one really listens when I talk.
response_post: That must feel isolating. Your thoughts deserve to be heard and valued.
rationales: Your thoughts deserve to be heard and valued.

seeker_post: I keep feeling like I’m not enough for this world.
response_post: That’s heartbreaking. You are enough simply by existing, not by proving your worth.
rationales: You are enough simply by existing, not by proving your worth.

seeker_post: I’m scared that people will forget about me.
response_post: That’s a painful thought. The connections you’ve made have left a mark that lasts.
rationales: The connections you’ve made have left a mark that lasts.

seeker_post: I can’t stop thinking about all the chances I missed.
response_post: That must be tough. Regret shows you care—it means you’re still learning and growing.
rationales: Regret shows you care—it means you’re still learning and growing.

seeker_post: I feel like I’m falling apart but can’t tell anyone.
response_post: That sounds painful. You don’t have to face everything alone—help is always within reach.
rationales: You don’t have to face everything alone—help is always within reach.

seeker_post: I hate that I can’t seem to stay positive.
response_post: That’s okay. Positivity isn’t constant—it’s human to feel down sometimes.
rationales: Positivity isn’t constant—it’s human to feel down sometimes.

seeker_post: I feel like people only notice me when I make mistakes.
response_post: That’s unfair to experience. You deserve recognition for your effort, not just your errors.
rationales: You deserve recognition for your effort, not just your errors.

seeker_post: I can’t stop thinking about everything I’ve lost.
response_post: That’s a heavy grief to carry. Remembering what’s gone shows how much it mattered to you.
rationales: Remembering what’s gone shows how much it mattered to you.

seeker_post: I feel scared of letting anyone get close to me.
response_post: That’s understandable. Protecting yourself is natural, but you still deserve closeness and care.
rationales: Protecting yourself is natural, but you still deserve closeness and care.

seeker_post: I hate that I can’t express my feelings properly.
response_post: That must be frustrating. Even small words or gestures are valid ways to communicate pain.
rationales: Even small words or gestures are valid ways to communicate pain.

seeker_post: I feel invisible even when surrounded by people.
response_post: That’s a painful loneliness. You deserve to be seen and understood for who you are.
rationales: You deserve to be seen and understood for who you are.

seeker_post: I can’t stop thinking I’m a failure.
response_post: That must hurt deeply. Failing doesn’t define you—it’s part of how success is built.
rationales: Failing doesn’t define you—it’s part of how success is built.

seeker_post: I feel disconnected from everyone around me.
response_post: That’s a hard feeling. It’s okay to crave connection—start small, even one conversation helps.
rationales: It’s okay to crave connection—start small, even one conversation helps.

seeker_post: I’m scared of being honest about my emotions.
response_post: That’s a brave thought. Honesty takes courage, and you’re already showing it by admitting this.
rationales: Honesty takes courage, and you’re already showing it by admitting this.

seeker_post: I can’t stop comparing my life to others.
response_post: That’s common. Comparison steals peace—focus on your own growth instead.
rationales: Comparison steals peace—focus on your own growth instead.

seeker_post: I feel like I’m always behind in life.
response_post: That must be difficult. Everyone’s timeline is different—your pace is still progress.
rationales: Everyone’s timeline is different—your pace is still progress.

seeker_post: I can’t stop feeling anxious about everything.
response_post: That sounds hard. Anxiety doesn’t mean weakness—it means you care too much at once.
rationales: Anxiety doesn’t mean weakness—it means you care too much at once.

seeker_post: I feel like nobody truly cares about me.
response_post: That’s heartbreaking. You matter deeply, even if it’s hard to feel it right now.
rationales: You matter deeply, even if it’s hard to feel it right now.
